intro: Guatteria glauca, commonly known as the blue guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocados. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to yellow when mature. Guatteria glauca is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
